Typography

HEADINGS

Headings create our headlines. You can see the different sizes to choose from. Choose as many as you like and place them in the HTML file.

H1. Heading

Add class="h-large" to the HTML tag

H2. Heading

Add class="h-med" to the any heading tag

H3. Heading

Add class="h-sm" to the HTML tag

TEXT

The <p> tag creates a paragraph. Choose as many as you need and place them in the HTML file.

Text large

Add class="t-large" to the HTML tag

Text medium

Add class="t-med" to the HTML tag

Text small

Add class="t-sm" to the HTML tag

Text italic

Add class="italic" to the HTML tag

Text undeline

Add class="underline" to the HTML tag

Text bold

Add class="bold" to the HTML tag

every letter capitalized

Add class="uppercase" to the HTML tag

every first letter of work is capitalized

Add class="capitalize" to the HTML tag

EveRy lEtTeR iS lOwErcaSEd

Add class="lowercase" to the HTML tag

Colors

Orange text with class="t-orange".

Yellow text with class="t-yellow".

Blue text with class="t-blue".

Skyblue text with class="t-skyblue".

Purple text with class="t-purple".

Gray text with class="t-gray".

Pinkgray text with class="t-pinkgray".

White text with class="t-white" and black background with class="bg-black".

Green background with class="bg-green".

Blue background with class="bg-blue" and white text with class="t-white".

Yellow background with class="bg-yellow".

Orange background with class="bg-orange".

White backround with class="bg-white" and gray text with class="t-gray".

Dark white backround with class="bg-darkwhite".

Darkgray background with class="bg-darkgray".

Pinkgray background with class="bg-pinkgray".

Lightgray background with class="bg-lightgray".

Grid

Grid enables the website to be ‘responsive’ or viewable on any screen in the same way. The pictures and other components size up, or size down. We place this code in with the CSS file.

Col 1
Col 1/2
Col 1/2
Col 1/3
Col 1/3
Col 1/3
Col 1/4
Col 1/4
Col 1/4
Col 1/4

Form

If you sell jewelry, you will need sales and contact forms to interact with your customers as they select and place goods in their shopping carts and perhaps contact you for customer service. That will require the use of a third file called Javascript, which is for creating actions on the website. Here are some important forms which can be placed in the HTML and Javascript (JS) files.

Buttons

Animated Buttons - "Pressed Effect"

Icons

Icons are small photos which allow us to know where we are in the website itself, such as the arrow key, and link to social media sites, such as Instagram and Facebook. You can see the pictures of the possibilities below, and use the code in the HTML, CSS and JS files.

Pinterest:

Instagram

Twitter

Facebook

Email

Search

Circled-left

Image

Images are placed in their own folder, and linked by URL, either on the HTML or CSS files. Here are some links to show how. Also, it’s important to make images responsive. It’s a simple matter, done by class on HTML and then linked on CSS, with the simple responsiveness code below.

Responsive Image

Helpers

Floats allow us to move a picture into the right place on our website. It’s possible to position it left or right on our CSS file. Here are some examples. It works best with clearfix.

Maybe your photo is a little too big for the textbox you wish to place it in, and it is floated, it will overflow outside of its container. Solution: Add the clearfix as a helper class to the containing element on HTML to make the page fit together well.

Image floats left

Image floats right

No-print

If you want to hide some elements in printed version, add class='no-print' in your HTML

Table

Tables are useful for comparing products and data. Some have colored stripes for easy reading. They can be styled either with CSS or HTML and placed in those files. Here’s one in HTML:

Table with borderd and responsive classes

  Name Color Material Size Weight Price
Ring Gold Metal - Yellow Gold 5 0.3oz $200
Braslet Pink Metal - Pink Gold L 0.7oz $150
Earrings Silver Metal - Silver S 0.35oz $300
Pendant Silver Metal - White Gold M 0.2oz $120

Table with striped and responsive classes

  Name Color Material Size Weight Price
Ring Gold Metal - Yellow Gold 5 0.3oz $200
Braslet Pink Metal - Pink Gold L 0.7oz $150
Earrings Silver Metal - Silver S 0.35oz $300
Pendant Silver Metal - White Gold M 0.2oz $120

Navigation Bar

The navigation bar helps users navigate from page to page and know where they are on the website. It often has a drop-down menu or two so that the user can choose the categories he or she wants to view. A navbar can be constructed by hand, or through the use of a CSS and JS widget. See the example below.

  • Shop
  • About
  • Contact

JUMBOTRON

A Jumbotron is a major photo typically used on the front page of a website, applicable through CSS and Javascript. Here is how to use the code in CSS and Javascript, with a link to HTML. Simple add class="jumbotron" to the containing element.

Title

A Jumbotron is a major photo typically used on the front page of a website, applicable through CSS and Javascript. Here is how to use the code in CSS and Javascript, with a link to HTML.

ACCORDION

Add class="accordion to the button and class="accordion-panel" to the container which you want to show up after clicking the button

SLIDESHOW

A photo slideshow, applicable though CSS and JS, will enable the buyer to scroll through photos without having to scroll down throughout the page. This is one useful way of displaying merchandise to potential buyers. Simple add class="slideshow" to the container where you want to input slideshow. The CSS and JS code is here:
